docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. P. Murali Doraiswamy of Duke University addresses reader questions about Alzheimer’s disease and other memory problems.

headline.seo: Ask an Expert About Alzheimer’s, Part 3
headline.main: Ask an Expert About Alzheimer’s, Part 3

docs.snippet: Dr. P. Murali Doraiswamy of Duke University addresses reader questions about Alzheimer’s disease and other memory problems.

headline.main: Younger Students More Likely to Get A.D.H.D. Drugs

docs.abstract: Students who are the youngest in their grades scored worse on standardized tests than their older classmates and were more likely to be prescribed stimulants for attention deficit disorder, a new study reports.
docs.snippet: Students who are the youngest in their grades scored worse on standardized tests than their older classmates and were more likely to be prescribed stimulants for attention deficit disorder, a new study reports.

docs.lead_paragraph: A drug crisis caused largely by an array of manufacturing problems is leading health care workers to treat patients with less-effective alternative medicines and expired drugs.

headline.seo: Drug Shortages Are Becoming Persistent in U.S.
headline.main: Drug Shortages Persist in U.S., Harming Care
headline.print_headline: Drug Shortages Persist in U.S., Harming Care

docs.abstract: Chronic drug shortages across the United States are forcing a wide range of medical professionals to turn to rationing and the use of inferior or expired medications, among other desperate measures; caused by an array of manufacturing problems, shortages peaked in 2011, but more than 100 drugs remain in short supply.
docs.snippet: A drug crisis caused largely by an array of manufacturing problems is leading health care workers to treat patients with less-effective alternative medicines and expired drugs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Commissioner Roger Goodell told an audience at the Harvard School of Public Health that the N.F.L. was working hard to combat serious injuries, including those from hits to the head.

headline.seo: Roger Goodell, N.F.L. Commissioner, Speaks on Concussions
headline.main: Goodell Speaks of Changes Needed in N.F.L. Culture
headline.print_headline: Goodell Speaks of Changes Needed in N.F.L. Culture

docs.abstract: NFL commissioner Roger Goodell says league is working hard to combat serious injuries, including those from hits to head, but argues that players' mentality is part of injury problem.
docs.snippet: Commissioner Roger Goodell told an audience at the Harvard School of Public Health that the N.F.L. was working hard to combat serious injuries, including those from hits to the head.
